etymology.description: 會意: 匕 ‘spoon’ used to eat/drink something delicious (orig. 𠤔; cf. 嘗; unrelated to 皀). Shuowen: 形聲—phonetic 匕 + semantic 甘 (‘delicious’).
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a spoon associated with tasting something flavorful, which extends to senses like “choice, fine” and later to “purport/aim” in texts. Traditional scholars also analyzed it as a phono-semantic spelling with 匕 supplying the sound and 甘 contributing the taste-related meaning.

examples.chinese: 我们此行旨在考察市场(我們此行旨在考察市場)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen cǐ xíng zhǐ zài kǎochá shìchǎng.
examples.english: Our trip aims to survey the market.

examples.chinese: 皇帝下达圣旨，命他回京(皇帝下達聖旨，命他回京)。
examples.pinyin: Huángdì xiàdá shèngzhǐ, mìng tā huí jīng.
examples.english: The emperor issued an imperial decree, ordering him to return to the capital.

examples.chinese: 报告要突出宗旨和要点(報告要突出宗旨和要點)。
examples.pinyin: Bàogào yào tūchū zōngzhǐ hé yàodiǎn.
examples.english: The report should highlight the purpose and key points.
